channel.title: Color codes
channel.description: I was working on something and i came across a color code i have never saw before... ok normal color codes i use are like 0xffffff, this is like... well white is -1, 255255255 shows up as light blue that is almost see through, -13131313 is bluish, -49088 is like an orange red, -328403441 is greenish, and it seems that a 0xffffff type color code can be = to one of these codes does any one know how to convert a color, say greyish(0x888888) to one of these color codes(-(#'s))

item.title: Color codes
item.dc:creator: @Hiaburi Hiaburi
item.description:
@Hiaburi wrote:

its not hex, becuase if it was then 255255255 would be white, its blue, a wierd blue that as it overlaps itself, it gets brighter…
-1 seems to show up as 0xFFFFFFFF -13131313 is blue also, it seems random to me, but its not becuase the pc knows exactly what to do with it and there is nothing in the code to convert the numbers…

Read full topic

item.title: Color codes
item.dc:creator: @White_Castle White Castle
item.description:
@White_Castle wrote:

en.wikipedia.org

Hexadecimal

In mathematics and computing, hexadecimal (also base 16, or hex) is a positional numeral system with a radix, or base, of 16. It uses sixteen distinct symbols, most often the symbols "0"–"9" to represent values zero to nine, and "A"–"F" (or alternatively "a"–"f") to represent values ten to fifteen. Hexadecimal numerals are widely used by computer system designers and programmers, as they provide a more human-friendly representation of binary-coded values. Each hexadecimal digit represents four b...

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Hiaburi Hiaburi
item.description:
@Hiaburi wrote:

ouch… ok sorry, but no i don’t see that option… jeez sorry i was confused, i also was drunk…
ok so i did all that and i have no clue what number he means when he says stick in a number so never mind…it was a legitimate question, that i could not figure out, and i assumed some one would be nice enough to help, not get called retarded by multiple people…

what is dword… all i know is its used in the regestry… and my schools retarded, they put me in pre algebra 4 years in a row when i do fine every year… so the most i know is…well y=mx+b lol…

item.title: Color codes
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

l2number

open up ur calculator, put it in scientific mode, change it to hex, make it dword, then stick in a number then convert to decimal
